basics.name: Shane Logan
basics.label: Network Engineer
basics.summary: IT professional specializing in networking and server administration and user support

work.name: Mad Mobile
work.summary: Managing systems and servers in the software development lab to enable and improve developer and tester productivity, as well as providing IT support for the local HQ office and remote corporate and contract users.
highlights: Operating systems, virtualization, data storage and management, and security

work.name: L3Harris
work.summary: Tier 1 network operations support in a 24x7 operations center, working with customers, service providers, and field techs to perform routine proavtive and reactive maintenance.
highlights: First line of defense maintaining an international, mission critical network

education.institution: Purdue University, School of Computer and Information Technology (Purdue Polytechnic Institute)
courses: Windows and Linux System and Server Administration

awards.title: Network Design Competition, Runner Up - 2nd Place
awards.summary: A competition amongst students (groups of 2), given an identical list of requirements for a hypothetical company's multi-site IP network deployment, who could design the best network implementation that fits the needs of the company. This was one of a two-part competition, the other being essentially a cybersecurity CTF campaign, where my competing partner and I placed 3rd.

Managing RUGGEDCOM WIN 802.16 WiMAX for reliable, long-range wireless uplinks (AeroMACS)
